website_summaries.verdict: A top-of-the-line hand mixer. A sound choice for most of your kitchen mixing needs.
pros: A compact model with plenty of power and features
Turbo Beater II accessories, Soft Start, and 9 speed settings make it versatile for numerous mixing jobs
cons: It's not as powerful as the Pro Line stand mixer, but it's practical for most mixing needs at a lower price

customer_reviews.title: Get a Cuisinart
customer_reviews.text: I hated this mixer. Kitchenaid does have a great "soft start" but this barely has enough power to cream butter. I'm going back to Cuisinart.
customer_reviews.author: Astute Consumer

customer_reviews.title: Mine Broke.
customer_reviews.text: I owned this for just shy of two years, which isn't that impressive since I only bake a few times per year. The plastic internal drive gears couldn't withstand the strain of using the dough hooks to mix dough. If I hadn't used it on cookie dough, perhaps it would have lasted me forever, but if I only wanted to beat cake batter, I wouldn't have paid so much. Sooo, if you need something heavy-duty, this won't suffice, and if you don't need heavy duty, there are much less expensive options that will suffice. This is a waste.
customer_reviews.author: MTFatBoy

customer_reviews.title: Not as good as my 25 year old Kitchen Aid Mixer
customer_reviews.text: It is lighter weight which means when you try to stand it on end with loaded beaters, it falls over. The speed controls are awkward to use. The vibration was horrible when mixing light loads or heavy loads as compared with my 25 year old one. I would not buy this again.
customer_reviews.author: Pittsburgh Joe

customer_reviews.title: Buy Only If You LOVE Cleanup!
customer_reviews.text: My first KitchenAid hand mixer was a champion, the best I've ever had. After 15 years it gave up the ghost and had to be replaced. This unit is has improvements in on/off switch and speed adjuster over the first, but the beaters don't seem to be in proper sync. I could run the original mixer at full speed, and batter would NEVER splatter outside of the bowl. This unit is horrible with that. Even on slow speeds it splatters batter all over the danged place. I expect to clean a mixing bowl, but not the counter top, wall, and nearby appliances after a round with this beast. I can't recommend this item.
customer_reviews.author: The Coach

customer_reviews.title: Pos!
customer_reviews.text: POS! The beaters did not spin smoothly, they wobbled alot, so I exchanged it for a brand-new one and had the exact same problem, I only bought this based on the excellent reviews it had I don't know if I just got 2 bad ones or what but based on my experience i would say do not buy it
customer_reviews.author: Hungry vegan

customer_reviews.title: Wobbles
customer_reviews.text: I already have a 9 speed kitchen aid hand mixer and am very pleased with it. I purchased my original one elsewhere. I needed another one for another residence. The one I received wobbled so bad I was afraid it was going to mess up the whole unit so I returned it. It seems when they stamped one of the rods where it attaches in the mixer it bent the whole rod. Poor manufacturing and quality control.
customer_reviews.author: Mutt15

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful mixer!
customer_reviews.text: I made the mistake of buying a Cuisinart HM-50 5-speed mixer, which turned out to be such a dud. I decided to get this one to replace it and there is no looking back! This is a great mixer -- versatile, easy to use, does everything well and cleans up easily. It is everything you'd want in a mixer, even mixing bread and other heavy dough. A great product with an array of useful attachments. Thanks, KitchenAid!
customer_reviews.author: Judy3338

customer_reviews.title: Can't beat it!
customer_reviews.text: I love the attachments: beaters, whisk, dough mixers and milkshake maker, but mostly I love the slow start. Really prevents making a mess. And the buttons on top are intuitive and easy to use. Very strong as well. I make a lot of mashed potatoes and these work well in the thick stages of making mashed potatoes. Definitely met my needs and my expectations. I highly recommend them.
customer_reviews.author: Mitchell W. MccOy

customer_reviews.title: Really like! Great silver color! Slightly heavy- but not bad
customer_reviews.text: My only complaint so far is it seems a little heavy and harder to control than the next model down I had. But I love the silver color- which matches my stand mixer. I would still be using the smaller red mixer but gave it to my daughter when she left home. Love having canvas bag for storage!- no more losing track of the attachments!
customer_reviews.author: T. McCullough

customer_reviews.title: awkward design- disappointed in a brand I usually love.
customer_reviews.text: I generally love kitchen aid products. I've had stand mixers, was given a cuisinart stand mixer and can't wait to go back to a kitchen aid. That being said, I had to replace my very old K. A. hand mixer and opted to upgrade to the 9 speed. I have VERY disappointed. The design for the power switch and speed is very awkward and difficult to work. Between the exorbitant price and the difficulty of use, I won't buy another until they change the design.
customer_reviews.author: D. Wales

customer_reviews.title: Dont but this product
customer_reviews.text: I have an old black and Decker so thought I would get a new portable for my easy jobs even after reading the reviews. It is pretty but is cheap looking and not made well. Power was a joke compared to my old portable mixer. Put it in the box after I unplugged it and returned it. Keeping my old one for now since it runs like a champ and has way more power.
customer_reviews.author: luvmiprime

customer_reviews.title: I haven't used the mixer that many times and the ...
customer_reviews.text: I haven't used the mixer that many times and the place where beaters go in started making a loud noise and now are wobble. I had them in the right holes.need it replaced.
customer_reviews.author: Janet Beik

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality for a Kitchen Aid
customer_reviews.text: Not worth the price. First one was damaged out of the box, slice in the power cord exposing inner wires. Amazon promptly replaced that one with another that the power cord has to be jiggled for the appliance to stay on, and the lowest power is about the same as the highest power....highest power struggles through whipped potatoes. Disappointed in this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Suzanne Leadley

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: To heavy to lift. Mixes well hard to reassess beaters and speed change is difficult
customer_reviews.author: Ray

customer_reviews.title: Hand mixer for lighter sauces and dough mixing
customer_reviews.text: This 9 speed mixer is a very basic hand mixer and it comes with several attachments. I had a hand mixer by Kitchenaid for years and it was great. This newer model seems to be less "powerful", but for mixing egg white and thin batters, then it will do fine. However, if you have to mix very heavy batters or doughs, then you will probably want to look into buying a STAND MIXER.That's why I also have a Kitchenaid stand mixer as a supplement, since the stand mixer does a nice job with heavier doughs ,& then I use this hand model for the lighter doughs (or for quick mixing of sauces). .
customer_reviews.author: Angeline

customer_reviews.title: I wasn't sure I would like it, I love it
customer_reviews.text: I have a KitchenAid pro 600 but do not want to take it traveling .. I purchased the hand mixer to travel with and am very surprised at the power. I can mix up a big batch of monster cookies ( using oatmeal not flour) a heavy dough. It mixes up with ease. I wasn't sure I would like it, I love it. It is a great addition to my traveling kitchen.
customer_reviews.author: Susan Landon

customer_reviews.title: Best step between cheap hand mixer and expensive stand mixer
customer_reviews.text: Wanted to move up from cheap hand mixer but had neither the money or the kitchen space for a stand mixer. This was a perfect choice. Slowest speed is actually slow, comes with all the attachments, mixes really well. Used it yesterday to make pizza dough and the dough hooks combined with the power of the mixer at slow speed completely eliminated having to hand knead the dough. Can't tell durability because I just got it.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew W OBrien

customer_reviews.title: Awesome little hand mixer!
customer_reviews.text: Had been using one of those cheap grocery store brand hand mixers and absolutely hated it. Had basically one speed - high and splatter food everywhere. So, I decided to take the plunge and buy this one. If you are hesitating, stop. Just buy this. You will absolutely not regret it one bit. The accessories/attachments are very high quality (and it comes with a very nice storage pouch to keep them in), the slow start feature is absolutely awesome, and it gets the job done very well. Just buy this. Seriously.
customer_reviews.author: JRM

customer_reviews.title: We have always had good success with Kitchen Aid which drew us to this
customer_reviews.text: We were looking to replace probably the last piece of kitchen (or any) equipment my wife brought to our marriage 28+ years ago. We have always had good success with Kitchen Aid which drew us to this. The multiple attachments, 9-speed capability and whisper quiet operation are great. You can use this for so many more uses than just what we were accustomed to with our previous "basic" blender. I can see this replacing our Kitchen Aid stand mixer for some recipes. Excellent choice.
customer_reviews.author: Mark E Moore

customer_reviews.title: Really wanted to like this. We have an old model that works ...
customer_reviews.text: Really wanted to like this. We have an old model that works well, but needs more power. Thought this would be perfect. However, it is so poorly balanced, it is hard to hold onto. So thankful for Amazon, not their problem, but manufacturer problem.
customer_reviews.author: kmac

customer_reviews.title: Very nice handheld mixer
customer_reviews.text: This is a good mixer so far. Reviews were mixed but I find it easy to use. Extremely easy to clean and store. Love it, love it. Update...12/19/19 still going strong no problem at all. Daughter borrowed and complained beaters kept falling out. Asked her to show me...yup, she had them wrong. One is bigger than other and if you put them wrong. Yes they fall out, duh, put them in right no problem. Kids, they never pay attention. It's well worth the money, I still love it!
customer_reviews.author: Carrol

customer_reviews.title: Pretty powerless
customer_reviews.text: If you're looking for power, keep looking because this mixer does NOT have it. I was looking to replace a simple & cheap 5-speed mixer I got from Wal-Mart because it just didn't have much power and would leave chunks of unmashed potatoes behind. I thought surely this expensive 9-speed mixer would not only do the job well, but look pretty while it was doing it....not the case at all. It may be a pretty red color, but it barely mashes potatoes on the highest speed. I'm extremely disappointed that I spent that much money on something that's almost worthless.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle M.

customer_reviews.title: WONDERFUL MIXER
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for my wife. Mainly because She already had a Kitchen Aid stand mixer that she loves and she was wanting a hand held mixer for smaller jobs. So, I figured If I stayed with that same brand I'd be ok. She loves it. It has 9 assorted speeds, It's very powerful, several attachments and is almost silent. You just cant beat the quality of the mixer. If your looking for a hand held quality mixer, this one is the one you want!
customer_reviews.author: impapascott1957

customer_reviews.title: How many speeds do you need?
customer_reviews.text: Short and Sweet: 9 speeds: do you need them all? Doubt it Price varies WIDELY, I suggest price tracking it Works well and easy enough to clean Easy to store, doesn't take space like a stand mixer Attachments come on and off easily Conclusions: I would go for the cheaper option with less speeds, but this will serve all of your needs and the kitch-aid name doesn't dissapoint.
customer_reviews.author: Cody

customer_reviews.title: Worth the Money!
customer_reviews.text: I needed a new hand mixer and wanted one that can handle big jobs when needed. This one fits the bill. I do have a Kitchenaid stand mixer, which I love. This hand mixer comes with all the necessary attachments for dough and whisking up egg whites. This one won't get bogged down in a double recipe of cookie dough at Christmas time no matter how many nuts or chocolate chips you add. It works like a pro on the big jobs.
customer_reviews.author: AH

customer_reviews.title: Good buy
customer_reviews.text: I replaced my Cuisinart mixer for this Kitchenaid. I like the locking option of the mixer cord and the added beaters that come with it. My only negative is the lack of power for this model. Pitting it against my Cuisinart it has limited blending power. It seams to struggle mixing things my old mixer had no issues withI purchased this based on user reviews and I'm worried this model will not last. I guess time will tell....
customer_reviews.author: Crosby

customer_reviews.title: Simply the Best
customer_reviews.text: Ok you guys, this is the Cadillac of mixers. Slam dunk! It is so quiet, your ears say “ no power”. But your eyes say” wow”, this thing has power. It sounds whimpy, but it’s not. Very well made. The slow speeds are SLOW, but that’s ok I guess as long as the high speeds can cut it. And they can. I have become a big fan of Kitchenaid over the last few years. I have yet to find a product they make that is anything but awesome. I am real, and I tell it the way it is.
customer_reviews.author: Joe bread head

customer_reviews.title: Best hand mixer I have ever owned
customer_reviews.text: I own a lot of kitchen tools and always believe having the right tool for the job is important. This mixer was chosen over the 7 speed and I am glad I did. The swivel cord is great for using it anywhere on my counter. The manual has a great breakdown of items and speed recommendations. The smoothie beater works surprisingly well and is probably the most used now instead of pulling out the full blender for a malt or smoothie.
customer_reviews.author: Justin

customer_reviews.title: Powerful--strong enough to make mashed potatoes easily
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased this mixer for myself and for my daughters. I also purchase it as my gift of choices for the many weddings in our large family. This little mixer is up to the challenge of heavy batters and is a great choice when I am not using my full size mixer.
customer_reviews.author: jkfooten

customer_reviews.title: slow to respond and so far I hate this electronic speed control feature
customer_reviews.text: I am an avid KitchenAid fan, however this mixer falls short. I received this mixer yesterday and have only used it once. Maybe I may change my opinion with more use, but the speed control is difficult to use, slow to respond and so far I hate this electronic speed control feature. Also the light that changes with speed change is blinding as well. It's mixing capability in my opinion is great and far superior to other hand held mixer brands on the market, once proper speed is established.
customer_reviews.author: JD

customer_reviews.title: Mine is better!
customer_reviews.text: It's OK! BUT I like my model better. I got mine about 4 or 5 years ago. The digital display and control up/down are fall better on my model. Plus I was able to get mine in Cobalt Blue!! Got this for my daughter. This newer model has the swivel cord, which mine does not. But I still like mine better!!
customer_reviews.author: Jazznme

customer_reviews.title: Pretty color
customer_reviews.text: My 40 year old Kitchen aid hand mixer passed away this summer causing me great distress. After deciding that I should go ahead and pay the extra $$ for kitchen aid's dependability and durability, I decided to go with this red as it was a few dollars cheaper than the others. I LOVE IT. The color is fantastic in my grey/black/white kitchen. Now hoping it lasts half as long as my other.
customer_reviews.author: baba

customer_reviews.title: Hit in the kitchen!
customer_reviews.text: Super quiet. When you have open concept and your wife likes baking. You need this bad boy. It is so quiet you barely know it's running. Yes it's light and easy to clean and all the stuff my baker likes, but for me, PEACE!!!!! Don't like to give appliances as gifts, but I am so glad I made this exception.
customer_reviews.author: DMAC

customer_reviews.title: I cannot tell you how amazing this KitchenAid hand mixer really is
customer_reviews.text: I bake all the time and have had the same inexpensive hand mixer for almost 20 years. It has served me very well, but finally died. I decided to buy a nicer hand mixer because of how often I bake. I cannot tell you how amazing this KitchenAid hand mixer really is. I have always heard that you should use a lower setting when making cheesecake (which I make almost every week), but mine always turned out well. How wrong I was, using the lower setting truly does make a better cheesecake because it does not add extra air making the cheesecake fall as it cools. The texture is also a bit smoother.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: LOVE THIS HAND MIXER!
customer_reviews.text: This was a gift for my daughter as she is beginning to have "new" items for her own place. She absolutely LOVES this mixer. She has the Kitchenaid Stand Mixer (also Empire Red) as well as other Kitchenaid products and LOVES all of them. I may have to buy myself one of these hand mixers as she is constantly gushing about it.
customer_reviews.author: MichelleS

customer_reviews.title: Not the best mixer I have owned
customer_reviews.text: I am a bit disappointed with this model for several reasons: The beaters are short and I can't beat batter of any depth without the batter riding up to the base of the beaters unless the batter is thin. It doesn't have as much power has my old handheld mixer and I wish the on/off switch and speed switches were reversed. It would be easier to push a button to increase speed than to do a slider. I would not recommend this model.
customer_reviews.author: Susyq

customer_reviews.title: RUN from this mixer. Does not live up to Kitchen Aid standards!
customer_reviews.text: I didn't use it right away and missed the short return window. VERY disappointed in this mixer. Low power especially for the price. Awkward to use. I have a kitchen full of Kitchen Aid and this one replaced an older KA hand mixer. My broken down one did a better job.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: Soft start is wonderful
customer_reviews.text: My old KitchenAid hand mixer was starting to make noises. I purchased this because of the different speeds and the attachments. Which I do like. Really like the Soft Start. I have a little bit of a hard time pushing the arrows up and down and it’s heavier than I anticipated. I do like the speeds. I’m a little concerned that it smells like wiring burning. Nothing smoking just smells. Maybe it’s because I have only used it twice. Overall I like it
customer_reviews.author: PLB OKC

customer_reviews.title: Just as expected from KitchenAid
customer_reviews.text: Replacement for a old KA hand mixer. Great upgrade. Very quite easy to use . Read negative reviews and see no merit in them. Controls user friendly, Accessory bag does not come with all models so check if that is important . Compared to Cuisinart my experience with other types of their products they just don't hold up
customer_reviews.author: D. Teschler

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t do the job
customer_reviews.text: This purchase was so disappointing - especially for an expensive name brand. Aside from the very awkward controls, this mixer doesn’t do the job! I try to cream butter, it all gets stuck inside the beaters - no mixing at all. When I try to beat egg whites, it takes forever, and still there’s a little puddle of unwhipped whites at the bottom. Whipped cream - e v e n t u a l l y but a hand beater would be faster!
customer_reviews.author: Esther Martin

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the hype
customer_reviews.text: It’s not worth all the hype. I have an old (10-year-old) kenwood that works better. I bought this because I’ve seen everyone use it. It takes time to adjust to it. The mirangue wisker keeps spitting the egg whites out of the ball. It’s not a horrible purchase, but it’s not the best..
customer_reviews.author: mohamed

customer_reviews.title: The mixer only worked at the lowest speed
customer_reviews.text: I didn't like that this. beautiful mixer did not move from the lowest speed #1 to the next speed level. It goes straight to off so it's impossible for me to use at only the lowest speed. For the price and brand name I ignored the 1 & 2 star reviews claiming they had the same problem. I don't want to risk getting a replacement item. I'd just rather receive a full refund. Thank you
customer_reviews.author: Angela B.

customer_reviews.title: The strength of the Kitchenaid
customer_reviews.text: I was amazed at how lightweight this is. Also, it is quiet but very powerful. It has numerous settings. I love this Kitchenaid.
customer_reviews.author: honey2010

customer_reviews.title: Kitchaid hand mixer
customer_reviews.text: Nice mixer, good power. Only complaint is that it is hard to turn it off with one hand. I hold it in my left hand ( I’m right handed) and the on/off switch is separate from the speed switch, so I have to use my right hand to turn it off. Minor complaint, but it’s awkward for me.
customer_reviews.author: Julie

customer_reviews.title: Addicting
customer_reviews.text: I finally have one of these with how long I've wanted one. I think the table top mixers are so useful but these I find myself using for everything. The settings make it super easy for you to find the options you need and the pouch holds the accessories for you. Cleanup is super easy and I haven't had any problems with mine.
customer_reviews.author: DSM

customer_reviews.title: I can count on KitchenAid
customer_reviews.text: Bought this because it has 2 more speeds than my 15 year old KitchenAid hand mixer. Have used it a few times, but haven't tried all the accessories which is why only 4 out of 5 stars. My daughter used it with the dough hooks and we were impressed! I look forward to at least 15 years with it like the last one, which I gave to my other daughter - the only one in the family without a KitchenAid! I like being able to rely on them.
customer_reviews.author: Sparky Jordan

customer_reviews.title: Great for casual bakers and junior chefs; intuitive features
customer_reviews.text: Finally saw this hand mixer in action last week and it worked like a charm - long power cord, easy to use, cleaned up nicely. No idea about durability - exterior white casing seems flimsy but who knows? We don’t bake much, but my beginner chef was using it like a pro in no time at all which is exactly what I was hoping would be the outcome when I made this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: VLH

customer_reviews.title: I like the mixing speed the most. It's at a touch of a button.
customer_reviews.text: lol once I got the hang of it. it was pretty easy to use. It mixes really well. It's made really sturdy. I would buy it again if it ever broke down. I like the feel of it in my hand.
customer_reviews.author: Lorrie

customer_reviews.title: I HATE it!!!!!  Don't get digital!!!
customer_reviews.text: I would return this in a second, but I've already used it, and don't feel that's fair. The problem is the digital speed control. I hate it!!!! It is so hard to use and control. The thing works, which is why I gave it two stars instead of the one I felt it deserved. We got a no-name mixer at the thrift store which is WAY better than this thing. I'm as technical as the next guy, but this habit of putting digital controls on every single appliance is not a good one, I think. It is so much easier to turn a dial.
customer_reviews.author: Noone

customer_reviews.title: Bad product; waste of money!!
customer_reviews.text: Bought it, but didn't use it much, very little in fact. Decided to use it for Christmas baking this year. Made it thru 1 batch of dough, then speed switch no longer worked. Past the warranty by DAYS. I take very good care of my appliances and this was definitely a manufacturing defect. Bought KitchenAid because of the brand name. Never again. NO GOOD!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: missmary999

customer_reviews.title: Love this model
customer_reviews.text: The mixing spoons are so nice to clean and the model is really quiet and blends well. I love it a lot, for simple eggs to thick doughs. Great purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Bekki Lee

customer_reviews.title: JUNK!!
customer_reviews.text: Beautiful to look at. I received it on Dec 25th as a gift from my husband. Now, May 23rd. I used it for cake batter tonight and the power increase button just quit in the middle. I reduced speed, and couldn't increase. It is stuck in the lowest speed. It is past the time of returning. For $100, I EXPECT it to last longer than 5 months ESPECIALLY with not more than a handful of light uses. I threw out my still working $15, 30 year old Walmart special. MISTAKE!! This thing is junk and I am angry!!
customer_reviews.author: kevin bullington

customer_reviews.title: Good hand mixer, so far.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my husband for Christmas. He wasn't thrilled about getting a mixer for Christmas, but when he finally got over that issue and used it, he was pretty happy about it. (He had been complaining about the inconvenience of the stand mixer we have for years, so I figured he would appreciate the gift.) He made a batch of peanut butter cookies and was impressed with the power for mixing in the dry ingredients. He likes to make his own pizza dough, but hasn't used the dough hooks yet. I'll come back with another review when he uses it for dough and let you know how what he thinks.
customer_reviews.author: Linda M

customer_reviews.title: Great value with the extra attachments.
customer_reviews.text: I have not had a mixer (stand or hand) in a very long time. My hands are getting weaker so I decided to purchase this mixer because it came with additional attachments and many positive reviews. The recipe of "Kindred's milk bread" is my very first use of this mixer with the dough hooks and it was challenging at 1st, but got the job done in the end. I didn't want my countertop space taken up with a stand mixer so this was a great compromise. I was getting by without this appliance, but it will make things easier in the long run.
customer_reviews.author: TXk

customer_reviews.title: pretty weak
customer_reviews.text: Not a ton of power. Seems pretty flimsy. I bought my last one at Walmart over 10 years ago, and I guess I was spoiled? Because this one was WAY more expensive and doesn't work nearly as well as the one I spent $20 on.
customer_reviews.author: amy

customer_reviews.title: Well made and plenty of power
customer_reviews.text: My wife loved this unit! It was very powerful and much quitter than her last big name unit that lasted 4 months she had.
customer_reviews.author: Roy

customer_reviews.title: Quiet Motor
customer_reviews.text: After 10 year plus of good use, my Toastmaster hand mixer finally gave up and so bought this hand mixer kitchen aid to replace my old one. Its very quiet when in use not like my old one although a little heavier than my old one. It had great attachment tools that came it. My only quesrion is why only 1 whisk when all of the other attachments came in pairs. Is it a manufacturer's error?
customer_reviews.author: Maldita70

customer_reviews.title: Seized up on second use
customer_reviews.text: This is the second such mixer that died an early death. This one went out in second use on CHRISTMAS DAY 1 hour before I had to have all my food ready!! I returned for a refund but I'd stay away from thus one for anything more than beating eggs or mixing wet cake batters, etc.
customer_reviews.author: Ginny Cornett

customer_reviews.title: Really like this mixer
customer_reviews.text: Good power. I like the beaters fitting the way they do. Nice design. Easy to use. Only complaint is on/off button seems backwards. To put on, the button is pulled back to turn off,the button is pushed forward. Not a major problem.
customer_reviews.author: Lin Anderson

customer_reviews.title: POWER!
customer_reviews.text: Love this mixer! It has terrific power without sending flour into the air. It works beautifully with heavier cookie doughs as well as lighter foods. It’s much quieter than most mixers. I highly recommend this hand mixer. Excellent buy.
customer_reviews.author: Michele Foster

customer_reviews.title: Great opportunity little power
customer_reviews.text: I have to confess that I was a little disappointed in the power, or mixing speed of the product. I like the look, the feel, but it seems to not go very fast. Our primary blender a stand kitchen aid I feel goes faster on a setting of two or three compared to this one on a max speed setting.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Highlight the input power supply information clearly.
customer_reviews.text: Overall is very good, but I just never noticed that the power supply for this product is fixed at 110V, which is not suitable for me to directly use in Singapore which the power supply is 230V here, so I have use a voltage transformer to step down the input power, hope this information can be highlighted in the description in the future.
customer_reviews.author: KONG WEI

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: LOVE this. After having the Artisan KA for 20yrs I wasn’t sure if I’d like the hand mixer as a replacement. I need the counter space but use mixers often. Glad I gave it a try! It’s great, powerful, & has many settings. Mixer attachment isn’t something I’d use. I really wish it was an immersion attachment.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love this hand mixer
customer_reviews.text: Love this hand mixer! I previously had a 3 speed and needed an upgrade. I struggled with the choice between a hand and stand mixer. I ended up with this one because of the versitility and cost. This model is sturdy and feels substantial like the stand mixer without being limited. The extra attachments were a definite bonus and the storage bag (not pictured) keeps everything together so my drawer stays organized.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda Flucker

customer_reviews.title: Must have!
customer_reviews.text: I have always loved my Kitchenaide products. This hand mixer is no exception. The power is exactly as advertised and can blast through double batches of loaded cookie dough no problem. The candy apple red looks fun and funky in my kitchen. Definite plus when you are living small and can not have a stand mixer in the kitchen. The little extra money is qorth the power to go for the 9 speed!
customer_reviews.author: Mendocino King

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy this one!
customer_reviews.text: This is quite possible the worst mixer I’ve ever owned. Under powered and expensive. I waited too long and missed the return by date.
customer_reviews.author: Murdock

customer_reviews.title: works, but not like the old one
customer_reviews.text: These types of appliances are no longer made as solidly as they have beenin the past. There are too many plastic parts, and not enough metal. That being said, this is one of the better products currently available. It works well, though I have not strained it much by trying to use it for anything but small jobs.
customer_reviews.author: zeozod

customer_reviews.title: Very Nice Mixer
customer_reviews.text: When you don't want to bother with your standing mixer, this is perfect. I've read the negative reviews, and I think they simply didn't read the instructions. Each beater is designed to fit into its own hole. If you pay attention to that, you'll be fine. Great accessories, thoughtful cord design, and easy speed shifting. Thanks!
customer_reviews.author: JRLF

customer_reviews.title: I love it!
customer_reviews.text: I like this color and design very much. It is fun to use. Because you can fine-tune the speed, making sweets is comfortable. The former speed was too fast and cream was scattered and it was scattered. That greatly reduced my stress more than before. It is pleasant without putting too much weight on the weight while holding it in your hand.
customer_reviews.author: FUSAKONOMURA

customer_reviews.title: Kitchen aid mixer
customer_reviews.text: Today was the first day I've had to use the mixer. I was very disappointed in the power. The beaters are very small. Overall I was disappointed in this mixer. If I have the option to return please let me know. I don't have the original packing materials.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great mixer
customer_reviews.text: I've continuously bought cheap hand mixers since I don't use them often. I finally realized that I'm getting basically 10 uses out of my cheap ones and then they tear up. I decided to get a good mixer after facing a complete Thanksgiving meltdown when my others gasped for air then choked. These arrived in time for Christmas dinners and they work wonderfully. Very strong, no problem mixing potatoes or cookie dough. I'm very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Sonya A. McKinney

customer_reviews.title: Best portable mixer for everyday use
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a Kitchenaid mixer and decided for a portable one. It is surprisingly powerful enough to make dough, cakes, cookies and whatever comes to your mind. Easy to clean and set up. Small that fits in every cabinet. Perfect for everything you want to make!
customer_reviews.author: Agatha E Right

customer_reviews.title: Great product.
customer_reviews.text: So many attachments, great for my use. Some people commented that cord gets in the way but I have not had this problem. Lots of speeds, so it's so great. Easy to use. Comes with storage bag for attachments. Red is a great color.
customer_reviews.author: W Ang

customer_reviews.title: It's KitchenAid—Of Course It's Good
customer_reviews.text: KitchenAid has put in the time and effort into providing quality products under their brand name, and this mixer is no exception. Good for somebody like me who can't justify the larger stand mixer, but still needs a good mixer for occasional use. I have friends who have the stand mixer but still use this on occasion when they're doing smaller cooking projects.
customer_reviews.author: Gmo

customer_reviews.title: Was a Christmas Gift Hit
customer_reviews.text: It was a big hit as a Christmas gift. "All I wanted was a cheap hand mixer." and this far exceeded the expectation. Good quality. Nice accessory sock included. Looks and sounds sturdy. Plenty of speed options.
customer_reviews.author: Jay

customer_reviews.title: Details!!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because it had good reviews and it was priced as if it is high quality. It works fine and I hope that continues but the silver sticker that wraps around the device was put on poorly and now I’ll have a stupid bubble/wrinkle on the front the rest of its existence. Kind of a slap in the face when you try to buy the best
customer_reviews.author: End The Fed

customer_reviews.title: Beater Wobble
customer_reviews.text: I was looking forward to having a quality hand mixer and thought KitchenAid would be it. One of the beaters wobbled and caused the whole mixer to vibrate. Amazon was great and sent a replacement right away but it too had the same problem. I sent them both back and will try another brand. I will say that it was quieter than my old mixer.
customer_reviews.author: pantry queen

customer_reviews.title: Excellent!
customer_reviews.text: Just as pictured. I bought the auqa color. I had one that was 15-20 years old but I melted a part of my cord so I needed a new one. Love all the accessories it cones with. Lots of speed variations.
customer_reviews.author: S Marcum

customer_reviews.title: Seems sturdy
customer_reviews.text: This is a sturdy hand mixer. My least favorite feature is the on/off button, which switches on opposite what seems natural to me. (Did I get a left-handed mixer? I didn't think there was such a thing!) Also, there doesn't seem to be a huge difference in the power behind each successive increase in speed. In other words, the highest setting isn't a whole lot different from the one several notches below it. The KitchenAid definitely feels a lot sturdier than my previous mixer, and I hope it will last longer.
customer_reviews.author: vickybee333

customer_reviews.title: pretty darn quiet
customer_reviews.text: I was so used to my old Cuisinart mixer sounding like an aircraft taking off in my mashed potatoes, I thought, at first, that this was NOT a very powerful mixer because it was so quiet and still in my hand; however, it whipped up my holiday mashed potatoes quickly and quietly. I like the options the accessories give me, and it doesn't hurt that this mixer is pretty. I'm especially looking forward to using the dough hooks for meatloaf to save my hands freezing (as another reviewer recommended). Initial impression = five starts. Should anything change, I'm pretty good about updating reviews.
customer_reviews.author: Kate M.Top Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Love
customer_reviews.text: I have a KA stand mixer so I had to have a hand mixxer to match. I love this thing. I use it on smaller jobs where I don't want to pull out the stand mixer and it works great. It has great power.
customer_reviews.author: amanda

customer_reviews.title: LOVE this mixer
customer_reviews.text: This mixer is quiet. The first time I used it I used the highest speed thinking for it to have power it needed to loud. I was wrong. Have not found anything that it will not mix. Helpful tip is definitely use the speeds recommended in the booklet to achieve the end product you are hoping to make. I absolutely love it. Am not sorry that I bought this instead of KichenAid's stand mixer. Probably if I baked and cooked more frequently, but being user of this mixer every other day leaves my counters free for other small appliances used daily.
customer_reviews.author: Mrs Noah

customer_reviews.title: Used it only three times
customer_reviews.text: Then it won't shut off. It only goes to the lowest speed but will no longer turn off. Apparently my 36 year old mixer was better quality. Guess I'll be going back to using the old one.
customer_reviews.author: R. Latimer

customer_reviews.title: I gave this as a wedding gift from a registry, so I have no personal knowledge of it
customer_reviews.text: I haven't heard from the bride, but I'll bet it's just great as are most other Kitchen Aid products. Am I being presumptuous? I hope not. I like being able to have confidence in well established brands.
customer_reviews.author: D. E. Miller

customer_reviews.title: its been great. I can actually use this without disturbing the ...
customer_reviews.text: This mixer is so quiet. I was actually worried about whether or not it would have the 'horsepower ' I needed but, its been great. I can actually use this without disturbing the household. I couldn't say that about some of the hand mixers I've used in the past. It would be great if it came with a box or bag but, I just recycled the bag from my old hand mixer. No complaints.
customer_reviews.author: Shannon

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for me
customer_reviews.text: I love it, it's perfect for what I do. I only do cakes that cames from the box. I do not make cakes from scraches so I do not know if it is good for more hard work, but if you only want make cakes that cames already read from boxes it is perfect
customer_reviews.author: Patricia Shapiro

customer_reviews.title: It's nice but not sure it's worth the money for the name.
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice blender. I don't really like to have to push a button to increase per I would rather just have a switch like what my cheaper blender had. I don't feel like it had the power of my older cheaper blender either.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Poor condition with full price.
customer_reviews.text: This is what I got. A poor condition with a full price. So disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: thao duong

customer_reviews.title: I'm going to sound like a curmudgeon but I liked old mixers better
customer_reviews.text: I'm going to sound like a curmudgeon but I liked old mixers better. My old mixer required a plug into electric, pop on the blades, and select the speed with a click of the thumb. This one has a specific blade for each side, a turn on and off button and then arrow keys to increase/decrease the speed. Just a bit awkward. I do love the dough hooks though. The mixer's performance is excellent. I just find that I fumble when operating it. It matches my red appliance theme nicely - if that matters.
customer_reviews.author: Kathleen

customer_reviews.title: Love this hand mixer!
customer_reviews.text: I also have a heavy duty KA stand mixer. This KA hand mixer is as good in quality and great for those in between mixer needs.
customer_reviews.author: ChiChick

customer_reviews.title: Great Little Mixer
customer_reviews.text: So far I used this mixer once and it has some many speeds it's a joy to use. I noticed it always starts on the lowest speed and you need to use the witch to move up to higher speeds...it would be nice if it gave you a choice to start at the last speed used. It's also way too expensive...
customer_reviews.author: William Carlin

customer_reviews.title: KitchenAid KHM9260B Hand Mixer is Perfect
customer_reviews.text: The KitchenAid KHM9260B Hand Held Electric Blender is perfect, especially if the job is too small to use our large KitchenAid Stand Mixer. We love it, for sure.
customer_reviews.author: Il cane

customer_reviews.title: Keep shopping, this isn’t the one.
customer_reviews.text: Under-powered and the speed control is hard to use. Who needs a frustrating hand mixer with fiddly controls? Not me.
customer_reviews.author: Desert Dweller

customer_reviews.title: Motor burned out on first use
customer_reviews.text: My first use of this mixer was to mix/knead bread. Just as I was finishing up, the motor started smoking. Currently on hold with KitchenAid.
customer_reviews.author: P. Holsinger

customer_reviews.title: KitchenAid hand held mixer is a must.
customer_reviews.text: This was a Christmas present for my daughter and everytime she uses it she calls to tell me how wonderful it is. She also has the stand mixer but loves the hand held for quick baking. She said she can't believe the power it has. Kudos to the KitchenAid hand held mixer. Worth every penny spent.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Can't beat a Kitchen Aid Mixer
customer_reviews.text: Besides Kitchen Aid reliability, this one comes with attachments in addition to the normal two beaters. One enables immersion blending. Check it out! I love this mixer!
customer_reviews.author: Wolfloner

customer_reviews.title: Good Mixer!
customer_reviews.text: This is a good mixer. There was only two things I did not like about it. It's kind of awkward to change speeds while mixing with the same hand compared to the slide button version. And same with the on/off switch. I kind of wish it would of slide up and down instead of side to side. But still a good mixer.
customer_reviews.author: C.M.

customer_reviews.title: Still works great after years of use
customer_reviews.text: Love my little KitchenAid handheld mixer. Have been using for years now. I have 9 children and bake all the time for others as well, so it gets plenty of use! Great little mixer :-)
customer_reviews.author: Meg77

customer_reviews.title: I want my old one back.
customer_reviews.text: I wish the speed setting was like my old one. Pressing the button multiple times to get up to speed is kinda annoying. It will do but I wouldn’t buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Patricia Marsh

customer_reviews.title: Powerful,and love the color
customer_reviews.text: I use this mixer all the time. It is powerful and mixes well.I rarely use my mixer with stand anymore. This does the job. I also like the fact that it comes with various mixing tools in a pouch,so it can be used for various dishes and drinks.
customer_reviews.author: Jmcm

product_meta.title: KitchenAid 9-Speed Digital Hand Mixer with Turbo Beater II Accessories and Pro Whisk - Candy Apple Red
product_meta.description: Color:Candy Apple RedMix, knead whip and blend all of your favorite recipes with this 9-Speed Mixer featuring and Exclusive Accessory Pack. This hand mixer comes standard with 2 Turbo Beater II Accessories, 2 Dough Hooks, a Pro Whisk, Blending Rod and Storage Bag to neatly protect and organize everything.
feature_bullets: 9 Speeds: Combine ingredients at speed one for slowly stirring in chunky ingredients, speed six for mixing bread batter and creaming butter and sugar, then speed nine for whipping meringue.
Soft Start Feature brings the beaters up to the selected speed gradually to help prevent ingredients from splattering.
Lock the cord into either the left or right side of the mixer so you can approach ingredients from any angle. The round cord is easy to wipe clean.
Soft Grip Handle provides comfort while mixing.
Easily and quickly remove any accessory from the hand mixer with the single-handed press of a button.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.7 out of 5 stars2,679 ratings4.7 out of 5 stars
